sentence.text: Kruppel-like factor 9 (cellular response to cortisol stimulus), a transcription factor, is critical for the inhibition of growth and development of tumors, whereas its effects in pancreatic cancer remains unclear.
The levels of cellular response to cortisol stimulus expression in adjacent tissues and pancreatic cancer tissues were detected using immunohistochemistry.

Using flow cytometric analysis and neuron migration-8, we evaluated the effects of cellular response to cortisol stimulus expression on cell apoptosis, the cell cycle and proliferation of pancreatic cancer cells.

Our results revealed that in both tissue samples and cell lines (particularly in BxPC-3 and PANC-1 cells) of pancreatic cancer, cellular response to cortisol stimulus exhibited relatively lower expression.

In PANC-1 and BxPC-3 cells, cellular response to cortisol stimulus overexpression decreased the proliferation of pancreatic cancer cells, induced apoptosis, blocked the cell cycle at the SÂ phase, and inhibited the migration and invasion of tumor cells.
